text: {{Infobox writer | name = Donna Williams | image = DonnaWilliams2011.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Donna Williams, May 2011 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Donna Keene | birth_date = 12 October 1963 | birth_place = Melbourne, Victoria, Australia | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = Writer | language = | nationality = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = 1992–2017 | genre = Non-fiction, autobiography, poetry | subject = | movement = Autism rights | notableworks = | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | portaldisp = }} Donna Leanne Williams (born Donna Keene; 12 October 1963 – 22 April 2017) was an Australian singer-songwriter, author and artist. In 1991, she was officially diagnosed as autistic. She wrote four autobiography books: Nobody Nowhere, Somebody Somewhere, Like Colour to the Blind and Everyday Heaven. She also wrote several books on autistic spectrum conditions. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:Writers from Victoria (Australia) Category:1963 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Australian singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Victoria (Australia) Category:Australian autobiographers
title: Donna Williams
